Job Title: Sr Manager, Safety Agreements & Alliances

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview

The Manager/Senior Manager of Safety Agreements & Alliances works collaboratively across the organization to develop, implement, and monitor safety agreements and alliances for Alnylam’s developmental and commercial products.

Summary Of Key Responsibilities

Work closely with the Director, Affiliate Management to support the overall strategy for the GPSRM Affiliate Management functionDevelop and support collaborative relationships with business partners and Alnylam cross-functional teamSupport maintenance and adherence to end-to-end safety agreement process and proceduresFacilitate the creation, maintenance, and termination of safety agreements in conjunction with GPSRM functionsIdentification and collection of key performance indicators (KPIs) which measure the health of safety data exchange activitiesPromote awareness of safety agreement commitments across Alnylam cross functional teamsFacilitate the integration of safety exchange activities and requirements into GPSRM operationsPerform regular safety exchange monitoring to ensure conformance with safety agreement commitments and oversee deviations/CAPAs development and execution for non-conformancesReview and assess PV regulations and perform impact assessments, as necessary, to ensure safety agreements and related procedures are compliant with regulatory requirementsConduct periodic review and update of safety agreementsEscalate risks and critical issues to Head of Affiliate ManagementIdentify process improvement opportunities and participate in process improvement initiativesServe as safety agreements and alliances subject matter expert for internal Alnylam team and external business partners, as necessaryPerform other Affiliate Management activities, as assigned

Qualifications

Education:Bachelor’s degree in life sciences or related fieldExperience:Minimum of 5 years in the pharmaceutical industry with a demonstrated focus on pharmacovigilance in a global environmentExperience working with business partners or third-party providers is highly desirableExpertise in the assessment and application of global pharmacovigilance requirements and regulatory complianceAbility to effectively prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneouslyExperience building consensus in a team settingAbility to effectively communicate and influence the outcomes of the decision-making processNegotiation skills encouraging discussion and driving decisions aligned with GPSRM and corporate strategyMaintains contemporary knowledge of current industry trends, standards and methodologies as it relates to PVEffective presentation skills and comfortable presenting regularly on safety partnerships, or Affiliate Management process improvement initiatives and projects at cross-functional meetings
About Alnylam: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (Nasdaq: ALNY) has led the translation of RNA interference (RNAi) into a whole new class of innovative medicines with the potential to transform the lives of people afflicted with rare and more prevalent diseases. Based on Nobel Prize-winning science, RNAi therapeutics represent a powerful, clinically validated approach to treating diseases at their genetic source by “interfering” with mRNA that cause or contribute to disease. Since our founding in 2002, Alnylam has led the RNAi Revolution and continues to turn scientific possibility into reality.

Our culture: Our people-first culture is guided by our core values: fiercely innovative, open culture, purposeful urgency, passion for excellence, and commitment to people, and these values influence how we work and the business decisions we make. Thanks to feedback from our employees over the years, we’ve been fortunate to be named a top employer around the world. Alnylam is extremely proud to have been recognized as the #1 Large Employer by Boston Globe Top Places to Work in 2023 for the third consecutive year, one of Science Magazine’s Top Biopharma Employers, one of America's Most Responsible Companies for 2024 by Newsweek, a Fast Company Best Workplace for Innovators, and a Great Place to Work in Canada, France, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, and UK – among others.

At Alnylam, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equal employment opportunity. We are dedicated to building an environment where employees can feel that they belong, can bring their authentic selves to work, and achieve to their full potential. By empowering employees to embrace their unique differences at work, our business grows stronger with advanced and original thinking, allowing us to bring groundbreaking medicines to patients. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, ethnicity, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics prohibited by law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
